Enabling Security

Now that you have defined an access control database, you must tell Serena ChangeMan Version Manager to use it to control security for your project database or project.

To enable the access control database for security:

  1. Select the project database or project for which this access control database will control security.

  2. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  3. If not already selected, select the Show Advanced Options check box.

  4. In the Options list, select Access Control Database beneath Security. The Access Control Database pane on the right appears.

  5. Verify that the location and name displayed in the Access Control Database field are correct. Modify it if necessary.

  6. Select the Enable access control database security check box.

  7. Click OK.

Projects that users do not have access to (because their user IDs are not defined in the access control database associated with the project) are displayed in the desktop client with a red X on the folder icon ( ).
